body.p: The criterion in paragraph 53(a) is not met if at the inception of the group an entity expects significant variability in the fulfilment cash flows that would affect the measurement of the liability for remaining coverage during the period before a claim is incurred. Variability in the fulfilment cash flows increases with, for example:

li.p: the extent of future cash flows relating to any derivatives embedded in the contracts; and
the length of the coverage period of the group of contracts.
